goals.question: What is the distribution of population in London?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of population in London and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: What is the average rent in different boroughs of London?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average rent by borough
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the average rent in different boroughs of London and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the relationship between crime rate and population density in London?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of crime rate vs population density
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between crime rate and population density in London.

goals.question: What is the distribution of green spaces in London?
goals.visualization: Heatmap of green spaces by borough
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of green spaces in London and identify any areas with low green space coverage.

goals.question: What is the distribution of ethnic groups in London?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of ethnic groups by borough
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of ethnic groups in London and identify any areas with high or low diversity.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['population'].plot(kind='hist', bins=50, color='blue', edgecolor='black')
    plt.axvline(data['population'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population in London?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('borough').mean().reset_index()
    plt.bar(data['borough'], data['average_rent'])
    plt.title('What is the average rent in different boroughs of London?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Borough')
    plt.ylabel('Average Rent')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.scatter(data['population_density'], data['crime_rate'], alpha=0.5)
    ax.set_xlabel('Population Density')
    ax.set_ylabel('Crime Rate')
    ax.set_title('What is the relationship between crime rate and population density in London?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('borough').sum()
    plt.pcolor(data, cmap='Greens')
    plt.colorbar()
    plt.xticks(range(len(data.columns)), data.columns, rotation=90)
    plt.yticks(range(len(data.index)), data.index)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of green spaces in London?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    df = data.groupby('major_category').size().reset_index(name='counts')
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 7))
    ax.pie(df['counts'], labels=df['major_category'], autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
    ax.axis('equal')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of ethnic groups in London?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
